description: From Latin calumniātus, perfect active participle of calumnior (“I accuse falsely”).

verbs.description: calumniate (third-person singular simple present calumniates, present participle calumniating, simple past and past participle calumniated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make hurtful untrue comments about.
examples: Hatred unto the truth did always falsely report and calumniate all godly men's doings.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To levy a false charge against, especially of a vague offense, with the intent to damage someone's reputation or standing.
